blog.name: ivadeshin
blog.title: Critical Role Fic & Related Nonsense
blog.description: a CR sideblog for fieldbears | chaya on ao3

summary: A Moment’s Peace (Fjorester) (1/?)
title: A Moment’s Peace (Fjorester) (1/?)
body:
“This is the only kind of water I’ll ever accept.”

Fjord looks and snorts at Nott, who’s up to her chin in the hot spring and looking more content than he’s seen her in weeks. “Too bad they’re so rare, then.”

“Then we’ll stop traveling,” Nott says primly. “It’s warm, it smells nice, you can’t drown. It’s perfect.”

“So I see.” Caleb, who’s sharing that side with her and Caduceus, reaches over to tip her head back gently and start washing her hair. She only peeks an eye open for a moment before allowing it.

“Maybe there’s a lot of crime in this little mountain town, we don’t know.” Jester shrugs her bare shoulders and looks around. “Lots of mysteries to solve? Missing people?”

“We’ve gotten better at those,” Fjord agrees.

“We still haven’t figured out where Yasha goes,” Beau mutters.

Jester lifts her hand out of the water, dripping, to pat Beau lightly on the top of her head. Beau frowns but endures it. “She’ll be back soon.”

“It’s fine, just,” Beau folds her arms over her chest. “You know, what if she needs help.”

“What if Yasha needs help,” Caleb echoes flatly, allowing the absurdity to set in.

“She’ll be fine,” Molly says with confidence. Caduceus nods in agreement and smiles genially, continuing to cup small handfuls of water and let them stream down his chest. (He’s the only one who isn’t at the very least up to their collarbones in water, but he’s hardly the type to complain.)

“Speaking of teamwork,” he adds thoughtfully, “didn’t the innkeeper mention something about a boar platter?”

Instantly distracted, Beau’s eyes snap open and lock on to him. “Yes,” she hisses.

“What platter?” Fjord sits up straighter. “What’d I miss?”

Beau reaches across Jester to whack Fjord’s arm. “When we were booking the rooms, the guy, the big chubby half elf guy, he said there’s a group platter Friday nights that’s four silver but it’s FREE if you and four others can finish it in under half an hour, they sketch your pictures and put it on the WALL.”

“And it’s all boar?”

“Fall-off-the-bone boar, I believe he said.” Caduceus is grinning. “He described the marinade to me, although I didn’t want to press him for the complete recipe… it sounds lovely.”

“Are firbolgs cheating for a food competition?” Jester wonders aloud.

“He’s skinny, though,” Nott points out from just above the waterline.

“Really skinny types can pack away food,” Molly says. “We had a guy for a while who weighed not much more than Nott, and he’d fill up a tent just by sitting there eating one plate of chicken after the other.”

Jester’s eyes go wide. “How many would he eat?”

“You’d have to ask Yasha, she was usually the one who prepped his food, but.” Molly shrugs. “Probably seven?”

Caduceus frowns at this. “What race was he?”

“Human.” Molly lowers his voice a touch. “Allegedly.”

Beau is counting heads. “We need four, who’s in? Caduceus? You ready for a new experience?”

“I’m not sure that kind of experience would agree with me, but I’d be happy to come along and cheer.” He tilts his head in apology.

“I’m in,” Molly says. “If we start losing, that’s what long sleeves and secret pockets are for.”

“Pocket chicken,” Nott says thoughtfully.

Beau turns to her. “Nott, you want in?”

“I think that might be too much attention for her,” Caleb says worriedly, and Nott nods agreement.

“You, then.” Beau points at him. “Skinny human man.”

Caleb rolls his eyes.

“Skinny human man,” Molly singsongs, making Fjord snort. “Skinny human man needs boar.”

“Thank you for literally comparing me to a side show.”

“Hey,” Molly says, pretending to be wounded by his tone.

Beau looks to Jester. “You hungry? You can fuck up some food.”

Jester can, Fjord knows this, but she’s shrugging indifferently. “I think I might soak a little longer. I still feel like I have swamp gunk between my toes.”

“Skinny human man,” Molly’s humming under his breath, pretending to serenade Caleb. “Come eat boar with us. Come eat too much. Come be victorious.”

“Please stop singing.”

“I will if you come.”

“Fine.”

“That’s three,” Beau says, looking around the circle. “Fjord?”

He feels a tail poke him in the side, and he straightens suddenly.

“Fjord, what’s wrong?”

“Nothing,” he says. “Just trying to get a crick outta my back.” He puts a hand at his tailbone, pushing his shoulders back and chest forward, making a face. “Um. I’m kinda swampy too, and I’m not that hungry. Caduceus, you sure you won’t be their fourth?”

Molly looks at Fjord for a moment, then up to Caduceus. “I’ll teach you the sleeve trick,” he offers.

“Then we’ll stop traveling,” Nott says primly. “It’s warm, it smells nice, you can’t drown. It’s perfect.”

“So I see.” Caleb, who’s sharing that side with her and Caduceus, reaches over to tip her head back gently and start washing her hair. She only peeks an eye open for a moment before allowing it.

blog.name: kanafinwhy
blog.title: Of changing and of shifting shape
blog.description: Scientist and fanfiction writer most days, space elf princess in my spare time. You may also know me as Beleriandings on AO3.

tags: if it was an animated series it would be easier but you'd have to do an animatic and
i am even less well equipped to do that
that first one is good because the lyrics about supporting each other and working together but also it makes me laugh because
of that one episode where they spent like the entire time trying to cross a damn river
also roses is such a fave for found family type dynamics but
i think it fits the mighty nein particularly well
summary: If I had the skill literally at all, I would make those very tightly-edited AMVs where each half sentence lyric is fitted to an...
body:
If I had the skill literally at all, I would make those very tightly-edited AMVs where each half sentence lyric is fitted to an extremely specific character or incident in canon, and the ones I would make for Critical Role would be

  • The Humbling River (Puscifer) for Vox Machina
  • Roses (Poets of the Fall) for the Mighty Nein

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: Give me prompts.

The next round of voting for future Critical Role minis from Steam Forged Games is here! 
This month’s options are as...
body:
The next round of voting for future Critical Role minis from Steam Forged Games is here!


This month’s options are as follows:


Aldor (Lyra’s love interest from The Slayer’s Take)

Kingston LaForge (played by Brian W. Foster in Sam’s Bar Room Blitz one-shot)

Kashaw Vesh

Also, the Vanessa miniature is available for pre-order.

This month’s options are as follows:


Aldor (Lyra’s love interest from The Slayer’s Take)

Kingston LaForge (played by Brian W. Foster in Sam’s Bar Room Blitz one-shot)

Kashaw Vesh

Also, the Vanessa miniature is available for pre-order.

blog.name: kacka07
blog.title: There is freedom in the dark.
blog.description:
KATE / 22 / CZECH
-
"Odysseus, on his journey home to Ithaca, is visited by a ghost. The ghost tells him that once he reaches his home — once he slays all his enemies and sets his house in order — he must do one last thing before he can rest. The ghost tells him to pick up an oar and walk inland, and keep walking until somebody mistakes that oar for a shovel. For that would be a place where no man had ever been troubled by the sea, and that's where he'd find peace."

tags: i think that's a good summary of the episode yeah

sam: no problem

body:
matt: this is going to take a little bit to get the boat out of here
sam: no problem
matt: i mean, through natural means. i don't know what you have at your disposal, but-

summary: Hundreds of years later, people tell stories of the great poet and musician Scanlan Trickfoot. His works are passed down and...
question: Hundreds of years later, people tell stories of the great poet and musician Scanlan Trickfoot. His works are passed down and considered to be some of the greatest poetry and music ever written. Everything he wrote later in life was written for and about his beloved wife, Pike Trickfoot. Love songs, poems praising her beauty and kindness, lullabies for their children. She goes down in history not just as a hero, but as one of the most loved women in history. His love for her becomes legend.
answer:
Forgive the aged fandom parlance but omg squeeee!

I see this and raise you a primary source history text on their letters to each other and to their family about each other.

blog.name: weirdgirl-14
blog.title: I Don't Do Much
blog.description: I am just a Humble Nerd.  Founder of Geometric Mistakes.

summary: Sometimes I think about Watching CriticalRole because my D&D friends all seem to follow it and it’s invested and stuff--- But I...
body:
Sometimes I think about Watching CriticalRole because my D&D friends all seem to follow it and it’s invested and stuff—

But I watching things from the BEGINNING, which means I want to start with their FIRST campaign—- and then the question comes up: Would I ever catch up?  Would it be worth?  Should I?

Not to mention I still have a List of Super Hero Shows and Media I want to watch.  I might try to watch Critical roles while I’m on Winter Break and catch up on the Super Hero things right now,

But Yeah~
